pli-tv-pvr10:0.3: 1. Training rules laid down in seven towns
pli-tv-pvr10:1.2: Putting the palms of your hands together—
pli-tv-pvr10:2.1: “What has been laid down in the two Monastic Laws,
pli-tv-pvr10:2.2: That comes up for recitation on the observance days—
pli-tv-pvr10:2.3: How many training rules do they have?
pli-tv-pvr10:2.4: In how many towns were they laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr10:3.3: And so I will tell you,
pli-tv-pvr10:4.1: What has been laid down in the two Monastic Laws,
pli-tv-pvr10:4.2: That comes up for recitation on the observance days—
pli-tv-pvr10:4.3: They are three hundred and fifty,
pli-tv-pvr10:5.1: “In which seven towns were they laid down?
pli-tv-pvr10:5.3: And after attending carefully to your explanation,
pli-tv-pvr10:5.4: We will practice for our own benefit.”
pli-tv-pvr10:6.1: “They were laid down at Vesālī, Rājagaha,
pli-tv-pvr10:6.3: And at Kosambī, and among the Sakyans,
pli-tv-pvr10:7.1: “How many were laid down at Vesālī?
pli-tv-pvr10:7.2: How many were pronounced at Rājagaha?
pli-tv-pvr10:7.3: How many were there at Sāvatthī?
pli-tv-pvr10:7.4: How many were pronounced at Āḷavī?
pli-tv-pvr10:8.1: How many were laid down at Kosambī?
pli-tv-pvr10:8.2: How many were spoken among the Sakyans?
pli-tv-pvr10:8.3: How many were laid down among the Bhaggas?
pli-tv-pvr10:8.4: Please tell me who have asked.”
pli-tv-pvr10:10.1: Six were laid down at Āḷavī,
pli-tv-pvr10:10.4: And three laid down among the Bhaggas.

pli-tv-pvr10:12.4: These ten were pronounced at Vesālī.

pli-tv-pvr10:27.1: “What we have asked, you have answered;
pli-tv-pvr10:27.3: I wish to ask you another question. Please tell me this:
pli-tv-pvr10:27.6: And those that are ‘after the third’.
pli-tv-pvr10:28.2: The ways that failures are settled—
pli-tv-pvr10:28.4: And we will listen to you.”
pli-tv-pvr10:29.2: And eight here that are incurable;
pli-tv-pvr10:29.3: Those that are serious are grave,
pli-tv-pvr10:29.4: Those that are grave are failures in morality;
pli-tv-pvr10:29.5: Offenses entailing expulsion, offenses entailing suspension—
pli-tv-pvr10:30.2: Offenses entailing acknowledgment, offenses of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr10:30.4: And whoever calls another names for fun—
pli-tv-pvr10:30.5: this is considered failure in conduct.
pli-tv-pvr10:31.2: Aiming at what is contrary to the true Dhamma;
pli-tv-pvr10:31.5: this is considered failure in view.
pli-tv-pvr10:32.1: When, to make a living—having bad desires, overcome by desire—one claims a non-existent, unreal superhuman quality; when, to make a living, one acts as a matchmaker;
pli-tv-pvr10:32.2: when, to make a living, one says, ‘Whatever monk lives in your dwelling is a perfected one;’ when, to make a living, a monk eats fine foods that he has asked for for himself; when, to make a living, a nun eats fine foods that she has asked for for herself; when, to make a living, one eats bean curry or rice that one has asked for for oneself—
pli-tv-pvr10:32.3: this is considered failure in livelihood.

pli-tv-pvr10:36.1: “There are six on ‘to be cut down’.
pli-tv-pvr10:36.2: There is one on ‘to be destroyed’.
pli-tv-pvr10:36.3: There is one on ‘to be stripped’.
pli-tv-pvr10:36.4: There are four on ‘no other, he commits an offense entailing confession’.
pli-tv-pvr10:36.5: There are four on ‘the monks have agreed’.
pli-tv-pvr10:36.6: There are seven on ‘what is proper’.
pli-tv-pvr10:36.7: There are fourteen on ‘at the most’.
pli-tv-pvr10:37.2: They were laid down by the Buddha, the Kinsman of the Sun.”

pli-tv-pvr10:79.1: It rains hard on a covered thing,
pli-tv-pvr10:79.2: it rains not hard on an open thing,

pli-tv-pvr10:79.4: thus it will not rain hard on that.
pli-tv-pvr10:80.1: A forest is the bourn of deer,
pli-tv-pvr10:80.2: the sky the bourn of birds,
pli-tv-pvr10:80.3: Non-being is the bourn of mental states,
pli-tv-pvr10:80.4: nibbāna the bourn of an arahant.
